blocks.text: The heat put in \( Q = (T_1 - T_2) \log \frac{T_1}{T_2} \) (2)
and thus the efficiency \( \eta = \frac{W}{Q} \) (fraction at risk).

blocks.caption: Efficiency of an Engine
blocks.description: The figure illustrates the efficiency of an engine working on the Rankine Cycle, with steam kept saturated by jacket steam.

blocks.text: Efficiency of an Engine working on the Rankine Cycle, with steam kept saturated by jacket steam.
Example 7: Find the efficiency of the engine whose cycle is given by area \( abcd \) in Fig. 107.
Work done = area \( abcd \) (the summation being of horizontal strips) = \( \int_a^b r \, d\phi \) = \( \frac{1}{a + br} \) = 1437.57.
Hence the work done is \( W = (2) \) = (2)
